rComments: Don is a wonderful, brilliant instructor who explores topics with wisdom and grace.  He creates a classroom environment that welcomes discussion and puts students at ease about sharing their questions (he will never put you on the spot, or blow you off).  Materials were engaging and revelatory.  Papers graded fairly.  No in-class exams!
Fun class if you're into the subject! Two 5 page papers, two short book reading responses, and two group ethnographic projects. Easyish grader.
Professor Brenneis is great, he's fair and knowledgeable about what he is teaching.  Good class to take if you're interested in soundscapes.

Brenneis is very nice/understanding, his lectures are interesting, although his voice is rather soothing, he encourages class discussion, we only had to write two short papers and two longer papers, and have two group presentations.

Brenneis is a very nice and positive man, but his teaching style is terrible (or not for me). He spends most of the class period asking other people their opinions and almost no time discussing theories. The essays focus on your feelings about sound rather than theories. It is easy and I'm sure if you went to office hrs, you would learn more.
Didn't care much for his teaching style. He often gets carried away on tangents which were not always relevant or informative. The class was relatively easy and straight forward.
Don is a great teacher who knows his stuff and is very helpful if you need it.

Brenneis is great! He knows a lot about anthropology and linguistics. Readings are interesting and sometimes class discussions are too. Attendance is not mandatory which is good. Two reading responses and 2 group projects. Really easy A..
An interesting approach to the subject. He was funny and inviting to our students to share ideas- making it easier for me to walk away with something learned and remembered.
Don is a great guy. He knows his stuff and will answer your questions when you ask them. The lectures can get boring at times but he tries to liven it up. Easy papers

I was very interested in taking this class. It sounded fun and innovative and interesting. Brenneis some how found a way to make it dull and I often got bored in class. However, he is a really nice guy and the material he assigns is interesting. He is also a pretty easy grader.

boring lectures that aren't mandatory, but you gotta go cuz he gives info on the group projects and assigned papers. he's really nice and likes when you participate in lecture. He has specific types of writing that he's looking for, so, if you're sketchy on if ur paper is good or not go talk to him. he's helpful. grp presentations were interesting

Don is a really nice man. He is not one of those grumpy ol' professors. Understanding and fun. For me, the class wasn't the best because I am not as interested in the material as I used to be, but in general he tries to make the class fun. For example, the group projects and presentations are fairly cool and interactive. Good readings :)

This is a really interesting class with good readings. I like Don's lectures mostly, although people tend to being up pretty lame comments and examples. Some discussions are fun. Group presentations are easy but I am terrified of public speaking and you have to do it twice. Overall pretty chill.

Don is pretty cool. He's really into his work and talks a lot about it. Sometimes his lectures in this class can get pretty tangential and irrelevant, but it's still easy to write your papers as long as you read the many books assigned. I like him he's a nice guy.

My most favorite Anthro professor! His classes are stimulating (if you participate in discussion) but they weren't too intimidating- the material was clear and  understandable and therefore the written work was manageable and not daunting. He was also very helpful during office hours and genuinely interested in individual progress.

I'm not sure why people have given Brenneis bad reviews -- he's funny, down to earth, helpful if you go to office hours and very flexible with the class schedule. While not all class time is spent getting important information, the research projects were fun and I learned a few things. Good, somewhat easy class, nice professor.

a nice man who really likes what he does/has done.  class is really boring and most of the students don't go.  i didn't do most of the reading but still pulled a B+.  work load is light, a couple papers and an easy group project.  i didn't really learn anything about law, though a couple of the required books were interesting.
evil course, do not take any course with him.. you will regret it...

Brenneis' class was great.  Very informative and well organized.  Professor was really open to new ideas and independent work.  However, he didn't really push all the students to maintain a high intellectua/academic level in the class.

I gotta say I liked the guy but I didn't learn that much from him.  It was one of those classes where I decided the best thing to do was read on my own and never go to class cause when I DID go I ended up either falling asleep or staring at his hands cause they tend to twitch a lot.

hes willing to help his students and is easy to approach, a very nice man, knows his material but his lectures are slow and boring, puts most of the class to sleep and shows boring videos. class is comprised of a group project a paper, and a takehome final. no section for class, ta wasn't helpful

His lectures are so boring they put me to sleep, the material is interesting but he is boring...he just has a voice that puts you the sleep...it's a constant struggle to stay away especially in a tues/thurs clas, also the TA annoyed me.
